reviewText: I truly don't understand the low reviews for this item.This series is great if you have time to kill and aren't looking for any action.
summary: Enjoyable if you aren't seeking action.
Title: Shining Hearts Complete Collection

reviewText: I saw this when it was online. It was only 12 episodes. But in all that time it has now real plot, it introduces characters but don't do anything with them. I was waiting for something,but all I really got was them talking about bread. I say if u want to see I say wait until u can see it free because I know for myself I would not pay for it.
Title: Shining Hearts Complete Collection

reviewText: It's funny how the anime industry tells us to support it then turn around and not license, and give an English dub to, anime titles that atleast try to be different. Props go to Section 23 for atleast making such an effort.Shining Bread is one of these "healing" anime that show people from all walks of life reacting normally to everyday situations. And whatever major problems they end up having to deal with, they try to do something about it. If you're expecting any humiliating femdom RomCom from this show, then of course you're gonna find it boring because it's NOT "humiliating femdom RomCom."More major thanks goes to the voice-acting staff over at Section 23 for their efforts. Even though it still feels sloppy and a bit unprofessional, but hey.
summary: So? What if it IS about bread?
Title: Shining Hearts Complete Collection

reviewText: This series looks very promising. It is based on a popular game in Japan and the plot seems like it'll only get better and better.But here is the inherent problem with Shining Hearts. It is...12 episodes of bread. Thats right, bread. You spend the entire time watching them bake bread and sell bread and do all things involving BREAD!!! When you start episode 1 you think,"I'm sure they'll progress the story along soon. It can't all be about baking bread." Then you hit episode 12 and you say,"WHAT IDIOT APPROVED THIS SHOW GETTING MADE!!! THERE IS NO PLOT!!!"The characters are not bad. Some are clearly rehashed from about a dozen other shows. But any potential this series has is constantly squandered. Moments of story progression are brief and next episode they are back baking more bread. There is also a lot unsaid and hinted at but they never progress the story enough to really reveal there is more to it than just bread. It is like watching 12 episodes of filler.I've seen a few bad animes but this one really raises the question of why they even did an entire season of it. I also question the sanity of the American publisher bringing this title here. If you want to bring a Sega game based anime to the states, bring Valkyria Chronicles. Don't bring tripe like this. Shining Hearts is a waste of time and money. Avoid it. Maybe if you are a fan of the games you'll find something here but I honestly lost all desire to ever want to play the games after watching this. When I saw Valkyria Chronicles anime, it did the opposite. It made me go out and buy a copy of it, then later a PS3 to play it and I do not feel I wasted that money.Avoid Shining Hearts...AVOID!!!
Title: Shining Hearts Complete Collection

reviewText: If you're a fan of Japan RPGesque anime then this is a good one to add to your anime collection just keep expectations of any real hardcore action or drama out of your thoughts though there are a few scenes that will give you a little bit of said action.The series seems to focus mainly on the more idealic peaceful village life where those who have drifted ashore a tropical like island go about their lives though mysteriously most of these drifters have one thing in common no memories of their lives before being found on the island.The animation is very well done and the soundtrack fits nicely giving a melodic tempo as well as serious paced tempo in the few dramatic scenes of the series.  The Japanese subbed and English dub did a very good job voicing their character roles so no complaints on that end.So if you like the more light hearted anime series that has a touch of drama/action this is a good series to try out but if you like hardcore action or drama like Gundam or Naruto and the like then this is a series you might want to pass on.
summary: An Entertaining But Pretty Light Dramatic Series
Title: Shining Hearts Complete Collection
